column5: What will typically happen with respect to water levels in the next 30 days in tme Minaki area? Will they open the dam in an effort to drop it as much as possible before freeze-up? What is the typical effect this has on fishing the system?jiggs

I've seen the water level drop about six inches a day after veryhigh water periods like they have had this year. I'm sure the dams will remain open in an effort to lower the level before freeze up. Ever fished a lake with water dropping that quick? It can make fishing really tough. Good luck.

I think the Whitedog dam is open every August and September. We've been up around Labor Day quite a few times - fishing seems to follow the weather patterns as usual - some days better than others, but none of our trips were a total flop. Looking forward to going this Labor Day also.

To view water levels in the Lake of the Woods/Winnipeg River basin see LWCB.ca A very informative page and they will be give updates regarding dam changes. They will be starting to slowly close the dam at the outlet of Lake of the Woods within the next week or two..
Thanks for posting that website - "iamwalleye1", I knew I had seen that before.Hey didn't you just get back from there? Planning on going up over Labor day - !
I am loading up as we speek! Gone for two weeks. I will give you a report then!
Will be looking forward to that update. Any other tips - jigs - spinners - etc.?
